citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection an updated record of animals on hand, environmental enhancement program for birds, and
records of acquisition for two spider monkeys and one racoon were not available for review by the inspector. Review of
records required by the Animal Welfare Act facilitates the inspection process by allowing the inspector to determine
compliance of documents and evaluate animal welfare. Records shall be developed, maintained on hand and made
available for review by USDA Officials during inspection. Correction date: November 14, 2023.

The enclosure containing four dromedary camels has a single water receptacle containing water that has become
greenish brown and very cloudy, with insects and organic debris floating on the surface. Dirty water receptacles
contaminate water and may lead to animal illness. Water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary to provide water
that is free from contamination. Correction date: November 3,2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
At the time of inspection an updated record of animals on hand, environmental enhancement program for birds, and 
records of acquisition for two spider monkeys and one racoon were not available for review by the inspector. Review of 
records required by the Animal Welfare Act facilitates the inspection process by allowing the inspector to determine 
compliance of documents and evaluate animal welfare. Records shall be developed, maintained on hand and made 
available for review by USDA Officials during inspection. Correction date: November 14, 2023. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The enclosure containing four dromedary camels has a single water receptacle containing water that has become 
greenish brown and very cloudy, with insects and organic debris floating on the surface. Dirty water receptacles 
contaminate water and may lead to animal illness. Water receptacles must be kept clean and sanitary to provide water 
that is free from contamination. Correction date: November 3,2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
